attributes.action: Ensure that Thurso District Council endorse the use of the Gaelic on all road signage into and out of the district, with immediate effect.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: As a regular visitor to the Thurso area, a keen twitcher (bird spotter) and a native Gaelic speaker with very little English, I am fed up with the contemptuous disregard shown to me and my kind by the town council. If I had a sgillinn for the number of times I've gone the wrong way down a one way street, or ended up outside the Thurso Arms instead of the local wildlife reserve (it's often difficult to tell the difference, especially with the trouble I've been having with the optometrist) I'd be sitting on a whole cnoc of them. Please help me by signing this petition and striking a blow for short-sighted Gaelic twitchers everywhere!
